abstract_summ: Understanding Wuhan COVID-19 transmission dynamics and the effects of prevention approaches is of significant importance for containing virus global transmission.The net relative rate of infection for China and South Korea without containment measures, that is, with free proliferation of the virus, lies between 10 and 40 %/day or doubling times of infected persons between 3.5 and 2 days.We study and compare the infection rate in different cities in China and provinces in Italy and find that the disease spread is characterized by a two-stages process.While most cities in China control the disease which resulted in the decaying stage, in other world-wide countries the situation is still becoming worse probably due to less social interactions control and overloaded health systems which reflects in the death and recovery rates.At early times, at order of few days, the infection rate in the city is close to constant probably due to the lack of means to detect infected individuals before infection signs are observed and at later times it decays approximately exponentially due to quarantines.
title_summ: People Behavior Changes in China during COVID-19 PandemicSpatio-temporal propagation of COVID-19 pandemicsCOVID-19 Epidemic Outside China: 34 Founders and Exponential GrowthControl dynamics of the COVID-19 pandemic in China and South KoreaThe impacts of diagnostic capability and prevention measures on transmission dynamics of COVID-19 in WuhanSpatio-temporal propagation of COVID-19 pandemics
title_abstract_phrases: People Behavior Changes in China during COVID-19 PandemicWhile most countries implemented measures to reduce people activities and gathering to contain the coronavirus, the outcome may vary significantly depending on how and to what extent people behaviors have been changed.While most cities in China control the disease which resulted in the decaying stage, in other world-wide countries the situation is still becoming worse probably due to less social interactions control and overloaded health systems which reflects in the death and recovery rates.Control dynamics of the COVID-19 pandemic in China and South KoreaSocial isolation measures reduce the population's infection rate with the COVID-19 virus, but its effectiveness is difficult to quantify.Understanding Wuhan COVID-19 transmission dynamics and the effects of prevention approaches is of significant importance for containing virus global transmission.The net relative rate of infection for China and South Korea without containment measures, that is, with free proliferation of the virus, lies between 10 and 40 %/day or doubling times of infected persons between 3.5 and 2 days.
